headline.main: Drug Maker and F.D.A. Revive Diet Pill Study

docs.abstract: The Food and Drug Administration and Orexigen reached agreement on new trial standards for Contrave, a pill the agency had rejected earlier this year.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration and Orexigen reached agreement on new trial standards for Contrave, a pill the agency had rejected earlier this year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Is the Food and Drug Administration loosening its tough stance on diet drugs?

headline.main: Exercise Spurs Teenage Boys to Stop Smoking

docs.abstract: Teenage boys who took part in a smoking cessation program and combined it with exercise were several times less likely to continue smoking than those who received only traditional anti-smoking advice.
docs.snippet: Teenage boys who took part in a smoking cessation program and combined it with exercise were several times less likely to continue smoking than those who received only traditional anti-smoking advice.

headline.main: Exercise Spurs Teenage Boys to Stop Smoking

docs.abstract: Teenage boys who took part in a smoking cessation program and combined it with exercise were several times less likely to continue smoking than those who received only traditional anti-smoking advice.
docs.lead_paragraph: For teenagers struggling to quit smoking, a new study has some advice. To break the habit, try breaking a sweat.
docs.snippet: Teenage boys who took part in a smoking cessation program and combined it with exercise were several times less likely to continue smoking than those who received only traditional anti-smoking advice.

headline.print_headline: Why Even Resolute Dieters Often Fail
headline.main: Why Even Resolute Dieters Often Fail

docs.lead_paragraph: A long-used weight loss rule — reduce (or burn an extra) 3,500 calories to lose one pound of body fat — is incorrect and can ultimately doom determined dieters.
docs.snippet: A long-used weight loss rule — reduce (or burn an extra) 3,500 calories to lose one pound of body fat — is incorrect and can ultimately doom determined dieters.

headline.print_headline: Recess Is Making A Comeback In Schools
headline.main: Recess Is Making a Comeback in Schools

docs.lead_paragraph: A dozen public schools in Chicago have votes to restore recess in response to a push by parents, advocacy groups and some city officials to bring more exercise and better nutrition to children.
docs.snippet: A dozen public schools in Chicago have votes to restore recess in response to a push by parents, advocacy groups and some city officials to bring more exercise and better nutrition to children.

headline.main: More Accidental Drug Poisonings of Children

docs.abstract: The growing use of prescription drugs by adults, from pain relievers to sleep aids and heart drugs, has led to an increase in accidental drug poisonings of children, new research shows.
docs.snippet: The growing use of prescription drugs by adults, from pain relievers to sleep aids and heart drugs, has led to an increase in accidental drug poisonings of children, new research shows.

docs.abstract: Why aren't the French as fat as they should be?
docs.snippet: Why aren't the French as fat as they should be?

docs.abstract: Why aren't the French as fat as they should be?
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS - You're reminded hourly, even while walking along the slow-moving Seine or staring at sculpted marble bodies under the Louvre's high ceilings, that the old continent is crumbling. They're slouching toward a gerontocracy, these Europeans. Their banks are teetering. They can't handle immigration. Greece is broke, and three other nations are not far behind. In a half-dozen languages, the papers shout: crisis!
docs.snippet: Why aren't the French as fat as they should be?
